round_best: Develop a test-time adaptation framework that employs a dynamic filtering mechanism based on reinforcement learning. In this setup, an agent learns to differentiate between noise and signal in the target data dynamically, rewarding decisions that retain and utilize beneficial datapoints while penalizing the retention of noisy outliers. This reinforcement model can adjust to varying degrees and types of noise in real-time, enhancing the robustness and accuracy of TTA methods in open-world scenarios with minimal human supervision.

round_best: Employ a dual-network architecture for test-time adaptation, where one network focuses on identifying and filtering out noisy data, and the other adapts to the clean target data. This separation allows for specialized handling of noise and adaptation, potentially increasing the system's overall performance in noisy environments.
